Bureau of Justice Statistics: Table #10:  State prison population as a percent of capacity, yearend 2000
Contact:  Allen Beck or Paige Harrison
Table 10.  State prison population  as a percent of capacity, yearend 2000
Note:  Data reflect the highest and lowest of the three capacities reported.
In 1999 California reported operational capacity for the first time; for comparisons
with previous years, use 1,041,139 as the highest capacity of State prisons.
a/Capacity figures were estimated for Connecticut in 1999 and 2000.
b/Excludes inmates sentenced to prison but held in local jails and inmates in private
facilities (unless included in the reported capacity).   See Jurisdiction notes.
